name: Valerio Selis
content: Dr Valerio Selis | Our people | University of Liverpool Skip to main content About Dr Valerio Selis is a Lecturer at the Department of Electrical Engineering and Electronics, University of Liverpool, and he is part of the Advanced Networks Research Group (ANRG). His research interests include trust management, the Internet of Things, embedded systems, machine-to-machine communications, human-to-thing interactions, wireless networks, network security, and nano-communication networks, with applications to IoT healthcare. He teaches Digital Electronics and Microprocessor Systems to undergraduate students, as well as Internet of Things to MSc students. Education: - PhD in Electrical Engineering and Electronic, University of Liverpool, UK. - MSc (1st Hons) in Computer Science, Università degli Studi di Cagliari, Sardinia, Italy. - BSc in Computer Science, Università degli Studi di Cagliari, Sardinia, Italy. Employment: - Lecturer, University of Liverpool, UK, 2020 – Present - University Teacher, University of Liverpool, UK, 2018 - 2019 - Post Doctoral Research Associate, University of Liverpool, UK, 2017 - 2019 - Product Development Director, Traffic Observation via Management (TOM) Ltd., UK, 2016 - 2019 - Development Engineer, Traffic Observation via Management (TOM) Ltd., UK, 2011 - 2016 - Research Assistant, Queen’s University Belfast, UK, 2011 - 2012
